title: Are You A Classical Or Romantic Voter?

options.label: C
options.text: They are led by a desire not to make anything worse.

options.label: D
options.text: They are aware that most things could be a lot worse.

options.label: B
options.text: They believe that everyone is probably slightly worse than they seem.

options.label: C

options.label: D

options.label: B

options.label: C
options.text: To identify the wrongdoers and respond appropriately.

options.label: D

options.label: B

options.label: D

options.label: A

options.label: B
options.text: They believe that dissenting views can be safely ignored.

options.label: C

options.label: D

options.label: D
options.text: By maintaining a strong military presence.

options.label: B
options.text: A greater emphasis on Classical electoral attitudes.

options.label: C
options.text: A balance between Romantic and Classical electoral attitudes.

options.label: D
options.text: A rejection of both Romantic and Classical electoral attitudes.

options.label: B
options.text: To produce and release hormones that only regulate reproductive functions.

options.label: C
options.text: To produce and release hormones that only regulate stress responses.

options.label: D
options.text: To produce and release hormones that only regulate growth and development.

multiple-choice.question: What is the main difference between the nervous system and the endocrine system in terms of how they communicate with the body?

options.label: A
options.text: The nervous system uses hormones, while the endocrine system uses electrical signals.

options.label: B
options.text: The nervous system uses electrical signals, while the endocrine system uses hormones.

options.label: C
options.text: The nervous system uses a combination of hormones and electrical signals, while the endocrine system only uses hormones.

options.label: D
options.text: The nervous system only uses electrical signals, while the endocrine system uses a combination of hormones and electrical signals.

multiple-choice.question: What is the name of the master gland in the human body that produces many hormones that signal other glands to make their own hormones?
How do hormones bind to their target cells?

options.label: A
options.text: Hormones bind to receptors on the outside of target cells if they are water-soluble.

options.label: B
options.text: Hormones bind to receptors on the inside of target cells if they are lipid-soluble.

options.label: C
options.text: Hormones bind to receptors on the outside of target cells if they are lipid-soluble.

options.label: D
options.text: Hormones bind to receptors on the inside of target cells if they are water-soluble.

multiple-choice.question: What is the primary function of insulin in the human body?
What is the name of the complex series of interactions between three glands that regulates various bodily processes, including digestion, sexuality, immune response, and stress response?
What is the primary function of the hypothalamus in the human body?

options.label: A
options.text: To produce and release hormones that regulate various bodily functions.

options.label: B
options.text: To analyze the blood for signs that something might be off and trigger the release of hormones.

multiple-choice.question: What is the result of the HPA axis being activated during times of stress?

options.label: A
options.text: The release of hormones that promote relaxation and calmness.

options.label: B
options.text: The release of hormones that promote energy and alertness.

options.label: C
options.text: The release of hormones that regulate growth and development.

options.label: D
options.text: The release of hormones that regulate digestion and immune response.

title: The history of the Cuban Missile Crisis - Matthew A. Jordan

multiple-choice.question: What was the approximate duration of the Cold War?

options.label: A

options.label: B
options.text: To counteract the threat from U.S. missiles in Italy and Turkey

options.label: C
options.text: To gain control of the Caribbean region

options.label: B

options.label: C

options.label: D

options.label: A

options.label: C

options.label: D

multiple-choice.question: What lesson was learned from the Cuban Missile Crisis?

title: How Americans got stuck with endless drug commercials

multiple-choice.question: In most countries, what is the status of TV commercials for prescription drugs?

options.label: A
options.text: They are allowed with certain restrictions.

options.label: C
options.text: They are allowed without any restrictions.

options.label: D
options.text: They are only allowed for certain types of prescription drugs.

multiple-choice.question: According to the American Medical Association, what is their stance on direct-to-consumer ads for prescription drugs?

options.label: A
options.text: They support the use of direct-to-consumer ads.

options.label: B
options.text: They have called for a ban on direct-to-consumer ads.

options.label: C
options.text: They have no stance on direct-to-consumer ads.

options.label: D
options.text: They support the use of direct-to-consumer ads with certain restrictions.

multiple-choice.question: What was the main barrier that kept prescription drug ads off TV before 1997?

options.label: A
options.text: FDA regulations requiring ads to include all information about the drug's risks and side effects.

options.label: B
options.text: Pharmaceutical companies' lack of interest in advertising on TV.

options.label: C
options.text: TV networks' refusal to air prescription drug ads.

options.label: D
options.text: The high cost of producing TV commercials.

multiple-choice.question: What was the result of the FDA's clarification of industry guidance in 1997?

options.label: A
options.text: Spending on prescription drug ads decreased.

options.label: B
options.text: Spending on prescription drug ads remained the same.

options.label: C
options.text: Spending on prescription drug ads quadrupled by 2004.

options.label: D
options.text: Prescription drug ads were banned from TV.

multiple-choice.question: According to the study conducted by Dr. Richard Kravitz, what was the effect of mentioning a TV ad for Paxil on doctors' prescribing decisions?

options.label: A
options.text: Doctors were less likely to prescribe an antidepressant.

options.label: B
options.text: Doctors were more likely to prescribe an antidepressant.

options.label: C
options.text: Doctors were not influenced by the mention of the TV ad.

options.label: D
options.text: Doctors were more likely to refer patients to a mental health consultation, but not prescribe an antidepressant.

multiple-choice.question: What is the concern about prescription drug ads promoting unrealistic expectations about what pharmaceuticals can do?

options.label: A
options.text: They may lead to overprescription of medications.

options.label: B
options.text: They may lead to underprescription of medications.

options.label: C
options.text: They may lead to patients not taking their medications as directed.

options.label: D
options.text: They may lead to patients not visiting their doctors regularly.

multiple-choice.question: What was the outcome of the massive ad campaign for the painkiller Vioxx?

options.label: A
options.text: It led to millions of people switching to Vioxx, which was later found to increase the risk of heart attacks and stroke.

options.label: B
options.text: It led to millions of people sticking with older drugs like Ibuprofen.

options.label: C
options.text: It led to a decrease in the number of people taking painkillers.

options.label: D
options.text: It led to an increase in the number of people taking Vioxx, but it was found to be safe and effective.

multiple-choice.question: What is the argument in favor of direct-to-consumer ads for prescription drugs?

options.label: A
options.text: They can lead to overprescription of medications.

options.label: B
options.text: They can educate people about diseases and treatments, leading to better health outcomes.

options.label: C
options.text: They can increase the cost of healthcare.

options.label: D
options.text: They can lead to patients not taking their medications as directed.

multiple-choice.question: What was the result of Merck's ad blitz for Gardasil?

options.label: A
options.text: It led to a decrease in the number of people getting vaccinated.

options.label: B
options.text: It led to an increase in the number of people getting vaccinated, potentially reaching more people than a government communications effort could.

options.label: C
options.text: It had no impact on the number of people getting vaccinated.

options.label: D
options.text: It led to a decrease in the number of people visiting their doctors.

multiple-choice.question: What was the Supreme Court's ruling on prescription drug advertising in the 1970s?

options.label: A
options.text: They ruled that prescription drug advertising was not entitled to free speech protections.

options.label: B
options.text: They ruled that prescription drug advertising was entitled to free speech protections.

options.label: C
options.text: They had no stance on prescription drug advertising.

options.label: D
options.text: They ruled that prescription drug advertising was only allowed for certain types of prescription drugs.

title: How to talk to people you disagree with

options.label: A

options.label: C
options.text: They both acknowledged each other's openness and took first steps towards understanding

options.label: D

options.label: C
options.text: A place where people can go to avoid dealing with conflicts

options.label: D
